data.title: Poor lunch buffet
data.text: We arrived a few minutes after they opened. Ordered 2 buffet lunches and 2 sodas. Surprised that it cost a little more than  $25. Pizzas had good flavor but all were luke warm at best. Not very many folks there and during the 50 minutes or so we were there no other pizzas were brought out with the exception of one dessert pizza. I had high hopes but to no avail. Will drive further to Old World Pizza in Inver Grove if we decide on pizza buffet again as in my opinion price and quality are better there.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Although the pizza is really good, there is a severe lack in customer service as well as efficiency.  Perhaps they were so eager to open they missed the part where they make sure the employees know what is going on. It is a complete toss up when it comes to getting what you ordered and plan on being there for a while even if you are picking up.

data.title: New location - Pizza did not taste good at all, very disappointing
data.text:
2 stars means that I was very disappointed with my dining experience and I will not be going back.  In fact, I'd suggest you look somewhere else for pizza.

I was excited to have dinner here because I have been a big fan of Savoy Pizza at the Newport and 7th St. locations.  We ordered two pizzas.  One had a lot of sauce, the other very little.  And, the dough on one of the pizzas was severely under cooked.  And the flavor didn't make up for it.  

There's too many pizza choices around to try this one again.
